com.hazelcast.internal.util.sort

Class QuickSorter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.hazelcast.internal.util.sort.QuickSorter
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    MemArrayQuickSorter

    public abstract class QuickSorter
extends Object

    Base class for QuickSort implementations. Works with an abstract notion of a mutable array of slots addressed by their index. Makes no assumptions on the size or structure of the slots, or on the way they are compared.

    Not thread-safe because the contract for implementing subclasses is stateful: loadPivot(long) must update the internal state which is later accessed by isGreaterThanPivot(long) and isLessThanPivot(long).

    • Method Detail

      • sort

        public final void sort(long startIndex,
                       long length)
        Sort the part of the array that starts at the supplied index and has the supplied length.
        Parameters:
        startIndex - first index of the region to sort
        length - length of the region to sort

      • loadPivot

        protected abstract void loadPivot(long index)
        Loads the data from the given index as needed to satisfy later calls to isLessThanPivot(long) and isGreaterThanPivot(long).
        Parameters:
        index - the index from which to load the data.

      • isLessThanPivot

        protected abstract boolean isLessThanPivot(long index)
        Parameters:
        index - the supplied index.
        Returns:
        true if the slot at the supplied index is "less than" the slot remembered by the previous call to loadPivot(long); false otherwise.

      • isGreaterThanPivot

        protected abstract boolean isGreaterThanPivot(long index)
        Parameters:
        index - the supplied index.
        Returns:
        true if the slot at the supplied index is "greater than" the slot remembered by the previous call to loadPivot(long); false otherwise.

      • swap

        protected abstract void swap(long index1,
                             long index2)
        Swaps the contents of the slots at the supplied indices.
        Parameters:
        index1 - the index from which to swap contents.
        index2 - the other index from which to swap contents.
